title:
Detecting Deepfake Talking Heads
from Facial Biometric Anomalies
abstract: A combination of highly realistic voice cloning, along with visually compelling avatar, face-swap, or lip-sync deepfake video generation, makes it relatively easy to create a video of anyone saying anything. Such deepfake impersonations are being used to power frauds, scams, and political disinformation. We describe a forensic technique for detecting deepfake video impersonations that leverages unnatural patterns in facial biometrics. We evaluate this technique across a large dataset of deepfake impersonations and assess its reliability to video laundering and its generalization to previously unseen video deepfake generators.
keyContributions: Novel identity-agnostic forensic technique that leverages facial biometric anomalies without requiring external references
Simple and lightweight model architecture with 94.9% accuracy that can be easily deployed at the edge for real-time detection
Robust performance against video laundering and generalization to previously unseen deepfake generators
